meanings.definition: Relating to or characterized by the progressive degeneration of the structure or function of the nervous system.
meanings.sent1: The neurodegenerative disease slowly affected the brain's abilities.
meanings.sent2: Her grandmother's neurodegenerative condition made it hard for her to remember things.
meanings.sent3: The neurodegenerative nature of the situation was no laughing matter.
meanings.sent4: The city's neglect of the park was neurodegenerative, leading to its eventual decay.
meanings.sent5: The doctor explained the neurodegenerative process in a way that was easy to understand.

meanings.definition: Causing or resulting in the degeneration of nerve cells.
meanings.sent1: The neurodegenerative treatment targeted the damaged nerve cells.
meanings.sent2: Exposure to certain toxins can have a neurodegenerative effect on nerve cells.
meanings.sent3: The neurodegenerative impact of the prank call was unexpected.
meanings.sent4: The neglect of maintenance was neurodegenerative, leading to the breakdown of nerve cells.
meanings.sent5: The scientist studied the neurodegenerative process under the microscope.
